 You could be in a match, clicking around the fountain and not contributing, and it'll still count you as AFK.

You don't have to fully leave to be flagged as AFK and receive a penalty after the game. Standing in one place for a prolonged period of time will flag you. Even just wandering around in base or a side lane or whatnot and not contributing to the game will flag you. Sure, you don't get the "hey, you're going to be disconnected due to inactivity" notice, but the game still knows and will penalize you for those behaviors.

This is the first time you've actually claimed not leaving *or* being inactive. The reason we're all making this very clear is that SO many people come around saying "oh I didn't leave the game" and they're technically correct that they did not leave. But then it turns out they were doing one of several other things that's functionally AFK and still gets you flagged by the system. So yeah, when somebody appears to be carefully choosing their words in order to be technically correct like that, it's going to be questioned.

I would say if you strongly believe you were falsely flagged, you should submit a support ticket to have them look into it. But realistically, it's just a leaverbuster penalty. By the time support gets to the ticket, you'll have worked off the penalty anyhow. And it's not like your account is in danger of a permanent ban, because that's an entirely different system. The worst that happens is if you leave another game, you get a longer penalty. But if you don't leave/AFK in games as you said, then that's not even a likely result.
He described literally the only ways to get a Leaver Buster. If you got a Leaver Buster notice, then you did one of those things, regardless of what you said in your OP.

I got a leaver buster last week out of the blue. Active game and everything. Yet the sheep still claim I must have AFKed.

Leave buster can still catch you if you stop playing the game but stay connected.

So if you're just roaming around your base and not playing the game, you're going to get hit with leave buster.

EDIT:

Just because you say that you're not the reason why some lane "went up in smoke" does not mean that you didn't go back to the base and give up on the game.

You can stay in the game and still get hit by leave buster because you're not playing the game as in "trying to win," vs "just staying connected to not get flagged as an obvious afk/leaver"
